You'll be able to explore numerous fields and bring a real-world perspective to whatever you pursue.
Our mission is to educate students to be ethical and socially-responsible leaders in a global community.
Everything you need to know about applying to Manhattanville can be found in this section.

Manhattanville offers more than 30 academic programs that will help prepare you for the working world, while providing you with a traditional liberal arts education. While you’re here, you'll be able to take advantage of everything New York City has to offer, while still being able to relax and spend time with friends on our 100-acre quad.
Make the first step towards joining Mville.
See the diverse selection of academic programs we offer.
Learn firsthand what we are all about.
Whether you’re looking to climb up the corporate ladder, prepare today’s youth for tomorrow’s world, or become an award winning writer, our graduate programs can help you get where you want to be.
Advance your career, while learning from experienced business professionals.
Don’t just read about education theories, put them to practice in the classroom.
Work towards getting your work published, while also learning how your writing can make a difference.

We'd love to see you on campus! Manhattanville campus tours and information sessions are offered Monday through Friday at 10:00 a.m., 12:00 p.m. and 2:00 p.m. There are select Saturday tours at 10:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. (Saturday dates are tours only – there are no information sessions on summer Saturdays.

We also have a convenient virtual tour if you can't make it to campus. On our virtual tour, you can view a map of campus with pictures and descriptions of notable places, such as Reid Castle and Founder's Hall.

High Schools, non-profit organizations and counselor groups that would like to coordinate a chaperon led group visit of up to a maximum of 50 students are welcome to visit and learn more about Manhattanville College. Please fill out this form to register for a student led weekday campus tour and please read the criterion for scheduling such a visit. Group visits are on a first come first served basis.

The Undergraduate admissions department will resume campus tours on Monday, January 6, 2020 and selected Saturday and Sunday tours starting January 25, 2020. You can pre-register on this page for your preferred visit date.
Additionally, please view this same page in late January for a complete listing of spring 2020 events and comprehensive visitation options.
To discover how to apply to Manhattanville College or to meet the admissions counseling staff please view the following link:
On behalf of the entire undergraduate admissions department we wish everyone a Happy Holiday season and all the best in the New Year!

Our enthusiastic student tour guide staff will provide a comprehensive informational tour of our newly renovated campus for our prospective students, their families, and for all campus visitors. In addition, they will share with you their own great personal college experiences. Join them for a guided walking tour and discover for yourself why they are proud to call Manhattanville College home!

Our student Outreach Ambassadors are tasked with phone outreach to prospective students and their families. They will keep our prospective students updated about visitation options such as open house and academically themed Saturdays. Additionally, the students can share with you their academic and student life experiences as part of the Manhattanville College community.

Joseph Garzione is the College's Welcome Center Director. As the front-line representative of the college, Joe coordinates customized visitation options, information sessions, and events for visiting prospective students and their families.
Have questions about events, campus tours, or need help finding a location? Call or email Joe. He's here to help!

Ready to join a student-led campus tour of our newly-renovated beautiful campus? We’re excited to show you around! You can even customize a visit through our welcome center manager and get to know our dedicated faculty and staff while you’re on campus. High schools and non-profit organizations may bring groups of up to 50 students for group tours. Schedule your visit today!

Our 100-acre campus is beautiful and picturesque, with a Normanesque castle overlooking a quad designed by Frederick Law Olmsted, the landscape architect who designed Central Park. Our close proximity to New York City supports numerous internship and networking opportunities, as well as access to one of the most important metropolitan areas in the world. Can't make it to campus? Get a feel for Manhattanville without leaving home by viewing our photo and video galleries.

Our scenic campus is located in Purchase, about 30 miles from New York City, which gives students access to tons of internships and other opportunities. The campus was founded in 1841 and spans 100 acres. It was designed by famous architect Frederick Law Olmsted and features a beautiful quad, conveniently located class buildings, and many renovated facilities.

As our servicemen and women return home we will build on our previous success helping veterans get an education to enhance their lives both personally and professionally. Manhattanville College is committed to helping veterans for their service to our great nation by offering exclusive scholarships and benefits to be used in conjunction with VA Education Benefits. At Manhattanville College, veterans will attain a first class education at little to no cost. Benefits and Cost breakdown coming soon.
Get more information about how to apply for post-9/11 GI benefits.

Manhattanville College has partnered with the Department of Veterans Affairs to become a Yellow Ribbon school. For eligible veterans, any difference in the cost of tuition and the benefits awarded will be paid for at no cost to the veteran under the agreement.
New York State Veteran Tuition Award (NYS-VTA)
The NYS-VTA is an award that is only available for combat veterans who are also New York state residents.
Chapter 33 Post 9/11 GI Bill educational benefits maximum award for an academic year is $19,198.31. This change is in effect for veterans that are using Chapter 33 benefits for the first time.

It is very important to note that veterans educational benefits provided by the United States Government are not taken into account when we package veteran students for financial aid. Veterans will also be able to apply for Manhattanville's GI Scholarship that provides up to $22,000 per year.
Please give us a call to further discuss the options for funding your college education. There are also many scholarships provided by outside organizations for veterans.

Manhattanville College will accept up to 90 transfer credits. Students must complete at minimum 30 credits at Manhattanville College in order to receive a bachelor's degree. Transfer credits from other colleges and military transcripts are evaluated by our Advisor to Transfer Students.
• For Accelerated Adult Undergraduate (APPEAL) and Graduate Business —
